name: UpdateUrlRedirectSettings
description:
Update settings for an existing URL redirect in HubSpot CMS.

This tool updates the configuration of a specified URL redirect in HubSpot CMS. Use it when you need to change the destination or other settings of an existing URL redirect.

parameters.name: url_redirect_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the URL redirect to be updated. This ID specifies which redirect's settings will be modified.

parameters.name: url_redirect_settings
parameters.description: JSON object defining the URL redirect settings, including destination URL, redirect style, and matching criteria.

isTrailingSlashOptional.description: Whether a trailing slash will be ignored.

redirectStyle.description: The type of redirect to create. Options include: 301 (permanent), 302 (temporary), or 305 (proxy). Find more details [here](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/cos-general/how-to-redirect-a-hubspot-page).

isMatchQueryString.description: Whether the `routePrefix` should match on the entire URL path, including the query string.

isMatchFullUrl.description: Whether the `routePrefix` should match on the entire URL, including the domain.

destination.description: The destination URL, where the target URL should be redirected if it matches the `routePrefix`.

isOnlyAfterNotFound.description: Whether the URL redirect mapping should apply only if a live page on the URL isn't found. If False, the URL redirect mapping will take precedence over any existing page.

isPattern.description: Whether the `routePrefix` should match based on pattern.

precedence.description: Used to prioritize URL redirection. If a given URL matches more than one redirect, the one with the **lower** precedence will be used.

routePrefix.description: The target incoming URL, path, or pattern to match for redirection.

isProtocolAgnostic.description: Whether the `routePrefix` should match both HTTP and HTTPS protocols.

id.description: The unique ID of this URL redirect.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the hubspot_cms API.

isTrailingSlashOptional.description: Whether a trailing slash will be ignored.

isMatchQueryString.description: Whether the `routePrefix` should match on the entire URL path, including the query string.

isMatchFullUrl.description: Whether the `routePrefix` should match on the entire URL, including the domain.

isPattern.description: Whether the `routePrefix` should match based on pattern.

precedence.description: Used to prioritize URL redirection. If a given URL matches more than one redirect, the one with the **lower** precedence will be used.

routePrefix.description: The target incoming URL, path, or pattern to match for redirection.

isProtocolAgnostic.description: Whether the `routePrefix` should match both HTTP and HTTPS protocols.

id.description: The unique ID of this URL redirect.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
